name: Triad Arpeggio (1 Octave)
description: Basic triad arpeggio ascending and descending through one octave. Foundation for all arpeggio practice.

name: Triad Arpeggio (2 Octaves)
description: Extended triad arpeggio spanning two octaves. Develops fluency and hand position shifts.

name: 7th Chord Arpeggio (1 Octave)
description: Four-note arpeggio including the 7th. Essential for jazz and classical repertoire.

name: 7th Chord Arpeggio (2 Octaves)
description: Extended 7th chord arpeggio spanning two octaves. Builds advanced finger independence.

name: Alberti Bass Pattern
description: Classic broken chord accompaniment pattern (low-high-mid-high). Used extensively in Classical era music.

name: Broken Chord (Up-Down)
description: Simple broken chord pattern alternating between root position notes.

name: Rolled Chord Pattern
description: Quick ascending arpeggio pattern simulating a rolled chord. Great for developing speed.

name: Waltz Arpeggio Pattern
description: 3/4 time arpeggio pattern commonly used in waltzes. Bass note followed by chord tones.

name: Spread Voicing Arpeggio
description: Wide interval arpeggio using spread voicing. Develops stretch and smooth hand movement.

name: 9th Chord Arpeggio
description: Extended arpeggio including the 9th. Common in jazz and contemporary styles.

name: Suspended 4th Arpeggio
description: Arpeggio using root, 4th, and 5th. Creates a suspended, unresolved sound.

name: Add9 Arpeggio
description: Triad with added 9th. Popular in pop and contemporary music.

name: Octave Leap Arpeggio
description: Arpeggio with octave leaps between notes. Develops accuracy in large jumps.

name: Triplet Arpeggio Pattern
description: Arpeggio in triplet groupings. Essential for developing rhythmic flexibility.

name: Diminished 7th Arpeggio
description: Symmetrical diminished 7th arpeggio. Each note is a minor 3rd apart.
